speech-dispatcher-0-11.commit_message:
Avoid using gcc aliases

which are not supported on MacOS

Fixes #851

(cherry picked from commit 095d994c711f78ada0226b238278d3dc3ade232f)
0.11.5 release
Add NEWS items

ibmtts: always set parameters

That takes only ~50µs and fixes random parameter dropping observed with
ibmtts.

Fixes #845

(cherry picked from commit be4757494e2cc376b34384d22b3b0e6433fa471b)

ibmtts: Disable using the module punctuation by default

We have no way to automatically know whether this is available (and it seems
that voxin's distribution does not provide it), and enabling by default may
provide spurious output when changing punctuation level.

(cherry picked from commit b2dc3dff433ed2ad65d108c56182d5a289072a82)

Drop duplicate socket close

fclose already closes the underlying file descriptor.

(cherry picked from commit 99a478ac9d2f948aa31ba5b3166a9541a17b8b2f)

Drop orca.sym

They have all been integrated in NVDA.

(cherry picked from commit cf446163432843949ed86614757108f847400e76)

Fix missing trailing backslashes

Signed-off-by: Patrick ZAJDA <patrick@zajda.fr>
(cherry picked from commit 58fd6d35272c959de1a87f247d2913a8316196b6)

Update CLDR to version 43 and NVDA symbols to latest version from source

Signed-off-by: Patrick ZAJDA <patrick@zajda.fr>
(cherry picked from commit a1d9b609cfd5c831e52892256d3305609f1b2fbb)

Add missing end event in audio queue

In the case of a pause request during some long speak, the module will
report as paused. We then again (see 8bead4f21721 "Add missing end event in
audio queue") still need to inject an end event, and we'll notice the pause
there.

Fixes #813

(cherry picked from commit b0d17f799caf4c2f4bfd1133616e15650a64621e)

Print loglevel in log file

(cherry picked from commit fa2d983070b1f9770cce1aaac3685d2ad5d12024)

Add missing end event in audio queue

In the case of a pause request during some audio without any index, we
still need to inject an end event, and we'll notice the pause there

Fixes #813

(cherry picked from commit 8bead4f217211828e3fa9a5dc736c840259a1ce7)

Improve python documentation for beginners

(cherry picked from commit e0ac5bd28e9362fdbde74dd5a678d7a3e1854b57)

Fix missing \n

(cherry picked from commit 9abb628259dbe1f2676267c174a1ad6586095bef)

Add more debugging information on config file discovery

(cherry picked from commit 926b83748a05a8e8bc95d4dc4d8f4e9c970ce61f)

Fix spd-conf not being able to set the default module

Fixes #813

(cherry picked from commit cb60de7466af0352769c056c702014727d621024)

Translated using Weblate (Portuguese)

(cherry picked from commit 2ad5c65be42042f8f29621d55d480ccaadccc683)

add --disable-doc

Allow the user to disable documentation through --disable-doc to avoid
the following build failure without makeinfo:

make[3]: Entering directory '/home/buildroot/autobuild/instance-2/output-1/build/speechd-0.11.4/doc'
  MAKEINFO ssip.info
  MAKEINFO spd-say.info
/home/buildroot/autobuild/instance-2/output-1/build/speechd-0.11.4/missing: line 81: makeinfo: command not found
/home/buildroot/autobuild/instance-2/output-1/build/speechd-0.11.4/missing: line 81: makeinfo: command not found
WARNING: 'makeinfo' is missing on your system.
         You should only need it if you modified a '.texi' file, or
         any other file indirectly affecting the aspect of the manual.
         You might want to install the Texinfo package:
         <https://www.gnu.org/software/texinfo/>
         The spurious makeinfo call might also be the consequence of
         using a buggy 'make' (AIX, DU, IRIX), in which case you might
         want to install GNU make:
         <https://www.gnu.org/software/make/>
WARNING: 'makeinfo' is missing on your system.
         You should only need it if you modified a '.texi' file, or
         any other file indirectly affecting the aspect of the manual.
         You might want to install the Texinfo package:
         <https://www.gnu.org/software/texinfo/>
         The spurious makeinfo call might also be the consequence of
         using a buggy 'make' (AIX, DU, IRIX), in which case you might
         want to install GNU make:
         <https://www.gnu.org/software/make/>
make[3]: *** [Makefile:492: ssip.info] Error 127

Fixes:
 - http://autobuild.buildroot.org/results/d4f193545eb31864a9bac5a9d05bba39d3c7ff3e

Signed-off-by: Fabrice Fontaine <fontaine.fabrice@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit b92e417e73dfe5ba0686bc9799000ab952e5303b)
